alert.note: Alert for Edwards; Gallatin; Wabash; White (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 10 at 8:16PM CDT until April 11 at 4:36PM CDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers and locations in southwest Indiana and/or southeast Illinois... Wabash River at Mount Carmel. White River at Petersburg and Hazleton. .Minor flooding of lowland areas continues on the White River at both Petersburg and Hazleton...and on the Wabash River at Mount Carmel. Both rivers have crested and will continue to fall through this week amid dry weather. Flooding is expected to end on the Wabash River at Mount Carmel by Tuesday morning....while ending on the White River at Petersburg Wednesday night...and at Hazleton Friday. Minor flooding primarily impacts local river roads, parks, and agricultural land. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Mount Carmel. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, River is bankfull in all locations. All oil field production ceases with the exception of pumping units on substructures. Access to these are by boat only. Agricultural losses increase dramatically. Farmers move livestock to higher ground. City of Mount Carmel leaves flood gates B and C in year round. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Monday /8:45 PM EDT Monday/ the stage was 19.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 PM CDT Monday /8:45 PM EDT Monday/ was 20.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling to 8.2 feet Thursday, April 20. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
